caption:
The photograph presents a striking and somewhat disturbing contrast between natural beauty and environmental pollution. In the foreground, there is a large pile of assorted rubbish, including metal scraps, household items like basins, and random debris tangled among green plants, indicating that the trash has been dumped in a natural setting.

Beyond the immediate pile of garbage, the photo shows a river landscape. The river appears broad and muddy, meandering through the scene with sandy, sediment-filled banks creating small islands and peninsulas. This part of the river is calm, with no visible flow or waves, suggesting either a slow-moving section or a possible drought condition as indicated by the exposed sandbanks.

The background features a lush green forest lining the riverbank across the water. The forest and the blue sky above contrast sharply with the polluted foreground, highlighting the intrusion of human waste into a natural area. The overall composition of the photograph creates a visual commentary on environmental degradation, showcasing the impact of human activity on natural waterways and landscapes.
title: The owner of this huge junk shop on the Kansas River in Bonner Springs died in 1971. Now there is only the river and the junk each day the river claims a small part.
